Junior Inventory Officer Job at Neveah Limited




        
    

        
        Neveah Limited is a leading commodity trading company established in 2014, with its head office in Abuja and five operational offices across Nigeria. The company specializes in the export of solid minerals and agricultural products, sourcing the finest raw materials from local markets to meet international demand. Neveah has now expanded into manufacturing, focusing on the recycling of aluminum and copper to produce ingots for export, further strengthening its global footprint.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Junior Inventory Officer
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Location: Mowe, Ogun [Lagos–Ibadan Expressway]
Employment Types: Full-time
Department/Unit: Supply Chain – Inventory
Directly Reports To: Planning & Warehouse Operations Lead
Internal Interactions: Procurement, Production, MRO

Role Overview


	Administer end-to-end warehouse operations in the inventory section, supervising storekeepers and ensuring stock accuracy.


Key Responsibilities


	Oversee daily warehouse activities, including receiving, picking, and issuing materials.
	Supervise storekeepers during day, night, and weekend shifts.
	Conduct periodic cycle counts and reconcile stock discrepancies.
	Update ERP records and maintain inventory logs.
	Coordinate with Procurement for timely replenishments.


Qualifications & Experience


	Diploma or Bachelor’s in Supply Chain, Logistics, or related field.
	2 years of warehouse or inventory experience in manufacturing.


Skills & Competencies:


	Leadership and team supervision skills.
	Proficient in ERP and warehouse management processes.


SMART KPIs:


	Stock Accuracy: Maintain ≥99% accuracy in warehouse transactions.
	Replenishment Lead Time: Ensure ≥90% of replenishments meet target lead times.
	Cycle Count Compliance: Complete 100% scheduled cycle counts monthly.
	Shift Supervision: Achieve zero unapproved deviations per shift.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their updated CV saved in their full name to: careers@neveah.com.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: Only properly submitted applications and qualified candidates will be considered.

Senior Human Resource Business Partner Job at SecureID Limited




        
    

        
        SecureID Limited is a smart card manufacturing and personalisation bureau with expertise in the deployment and integration of digital solutions. Historically, we are positioned as the first commercially operated smart card manufacturing plant in sub-Saharan Africa with the ability to manufacture Poly-carbonate Cards amongst other card types.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Senior Human Resource Business Partner

Job Location: Oshodi - Isolo, Lagos

Role Responsibilities
Performance Management:
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Drive the performance management process, ensuring timely goal setting, performance reviews, and continuous feedback.
	Provide guidance on performance improvement plans and career development discussions.
	Train managers and employees on performance management tools and best practices.Analyze performance trends and recommend strategies to enhance productivity and engagement.


Employee Engagement:


	Develop and implement initiatives to enhance employee experience and workplace culture.
	Facilitate employee engagement surveys, analyze results, and drive action plans.
	Promote employee recognition programs that align with company values and business objectives.
	Organize town halls, team-building activities, and other engagement initiatives.


Employee Relations Management:


	Serve as a trusted advisor to managers and employees on workplace issues, providing conflict resolution and mediation support.
	Ensure compliance with labor laws, company policies, and best HR practices.
	Investigate employee grievances and disciplinary matters, ensuring fair and consistent resolution.
	Implement policies and programs that promote diversity, equity, and inclusion.


HR Services & Compliance:


	Ensure timely and efficient HR service delivery, including benefits administration, payroll coordination, and HR systems management.
	Maintain accurate employee records and HR documentation in compliance with company policies and legal requirements.
	Support HR audits, reporting, and data analysis for informed decision-making.
	Drive continuous process improvement in HR service delivery to enhance efficiency and employee satisfaction.
	Any other task as assigned.


Educational & Professional Requirements


	 Bachelor's Degree in Marketing, Business Administration, or a related field.
	 MBA or advanced degree in Marketing or Business Administration
	 Certification in marketing, such as CIM or NIM.


Competencies & Skills:


	A bachelor’s degree in science or engineering,
	Minimum of 5 years of proven work experience
	HR Certification is an advantage
	Proven record of workforce development in a manufacturing or Technology Organization

  "title": "Graduate Trainee Sales Executive",
  "description": "Snapnet, a leading technology consulting firm and certified partner of Microsoft, AWS, Oracle, Huawei, and other global OEMs. Snapnet is an ICT Consulting firm with strategic focus in developing Industry specific solutions, Business consulting and Systems Integration with offices in Lagos and Abuja, Nigeria. We are committed to delivering first class innovation, quality, and state of the art technology solutions to discerning clients both in the private and public sector.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Graduate Trainee Sales Executive

Job Location:&nbsp;Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

With a strong presence in the Nigerian market, Sonia Foods Industries Limited has established itself as a trusted and renowned brand known for its high-quality tomato-based food and beverages.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Procurement Officer - Agro Sourcing

Job Locations: Ikeja, Lagos, Oyo & Abeokuta, Ijebu-Ode - Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

	We are seeking proactive and experienced procurement officers with a strong background in agro-commodity sourcing to join our growing team.
	The ideal candidates will be responsible for identifying, sourcing, and managing vendors for agricultural produce such as Garri, garlic, Ginger, and related products, while ensuring quality, cost-effectiveness, and timely delivery.
	This role requires a strong understanding of local markets, negotiation skills, and an extensive supplier network across the specified regions.

	Identify and engage reliable vendors and aggregators for agro-commodities such as Garri, garlic, Ginger, etc.
	Conduct regular market analysis to understand price trends, supply chain challenges, and sourcing opportunities.

	Ensure compliance with company procurement policies and relevant local regulations.

	At least 2–5 years of experience in agro-commodity sourcing or procurement within the agriculture or FMCG industry.
	Proven field experience in sourcing Garri, garlic, Ginger, or other agro-based raw materials.
	Excellent knowledge of local markets, supplier landscapes, and pricing dynamics in Ijebu-Ode, Abeokuta, Oyo, and/or Lagos.
	Strong negotiation, communication, and interpersonal skills.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, Outlook).
	Ability to travel frequently within assigned region(s).
	Integrity, accountability, and a results-driven mindset.
